train.py

This is the module that trains the model.

check_params(params)[source]

Checks the Trainer parameters.

Parameters:

params (dict[str, Any]) – parameters.

class Trainer(params)[source]

Bases: object

Trains the model.

  • You can train in various combinations depending on the configuration of each class in the table below. If you want to use other configuration, implement them in the each functions.

    class

    function

    data

    lib.data.setup.SetupData

    optimizer method

    lib.optimizer.setup.SetupOpt

    loss function

    lib.loss.setup.SetupLoss

    metrics

    lib.metrics.setup.SetupMetrics

    callback

    lib.callbacks.setup.SetupCallbacks

    model

    lib.model.setup.SetupModel
Parameters:

params (dict[str, Any]) – parameters.

train_data

data class (train)

Type:

BaseLoadData

valid_data

data class (valid)

Type:

BaseLoadData

classes = {}

class list

  • key=opt: optimizer method class

  • key=loss: loss function class

  • key=metrics: list of metrics classes

Type:

ClassVar[dict[str, Any]]

model

model class

Type:

BaseModel

callbacks

list of callback classes

Type:

list[Callable]

load_dataset()[source]

Loads the training and validation data.

  • The training data must be loaded, but the validation data does not necessarily have to be loaded.

setup()[source]

Sets up the training.

  • Sets the optimizer method, loss function, model, metrics, and callbacks.

  • Run .summary.

run()[source]

Runs training and validation.

  • Run .compile and .fit.

main(params)[source]

main.

This function is decorated by @save_params_log and @process_time.

Parameters:

params (dict[str, Any]) – parameters.

Returns:

dict[str, Any] – parameters.

set_params()[source]

Sets the command line arguments and file parameters.

  • Set only common parameters as command line arguments.

  • Other necessary parameters are set in the file parameters.

  • Use a yaml file. (lib.common.file.load_yaml())

Returns:

dict[str, Any] – parameters.

Attention

Command line arguments are overridden by file parameters. This means that if you want to set everything using file parameters, you don’t necessarily need to use command line arguments.
